pros: Good team! Great facility. Hydroworx Pool. Patient focused. Not a contract company!
cons: Takes some time to facilitate change.

pros: Getting to know the people in the community.
cons: All the training you need to learn before you even learn your actual job position.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Sartell, MN
pros: they are very flexible with hours
cons: Being on call is too much. 1 week every 3 weeks.

review_title: I loved working at country manor
job_title: Home Health Aide in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: The clients were so patient and welcoming and so kind hearted the coworkers were all so helpful and very kind
cons: No cons I loved everything about working at country manor

pros: Personally, I loved working here. I was apart of the rehab/activities team and that team felt like family. I loved working with the residents and they always gave me so much joy. If you're looking for a job in the healthcare field I would recommend working at Country Manor.
cons: Honestly, the only con was I wish I could have worked more hours!

pros: Good coworkers, some good management.  Liked interacting with the Assisted living residents.
cons: Confusing management structure between the Store and the Pharmacy departments.  Pharmacy kept wanting store personnel to do the menial part of their jobs for them, but not help store personnel in turn.  Can be slow paced.  Low pay.

pros: Great place to work!! Staff were friendly and always willing to lend a hand to their residents. Really embraced the "hometown" feel
cons: Nothing that I can really think of. Management always makes employees feel heard and respected. Taking time off is pretty easy if you give notice far enough ahead

pros: The staff is great to work with, very team oriented. Being a new CNA, everyone was so helpful and always showing me the ropes. Flexible scheduling for us students!!
cons: The only downside about working here was the scheduling, higher up staff was unable to organize the schedule properly.
